verses.verse: Jacob<WH3290> lived<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of his father<WH1>'s travels,<WH4033> in the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667>

This is the history<WH8435> of the generations<WH8435> of Jacob.<WH3290> Joseph,<WH3130> being seventeen<WH6240> years<WH8141> old,<WH1121> was feeding<WH7462> the flock<WH6629> with his brothers.<WH251> He was a boy<WH5288> with the sons<WH1121> of Bilhah<WH1090> and Zilpah,<WH2153> his father<WH1>'s wives.<WH802> Joseph<WH3130> brought<WH935> an evil<WH7451> report<WH1681> of them to their father.<WH1>

Now Israel<WH3478> loved<WH157> Joseph<WH3130> more than all his children,<WH1121> because he was the son<WH1121> of his old age,<WH2208> and he made<WH6213> him a coat<WH3801> of many colors.<WH6446>
His brothers<WH251> saw<WH7200> that their father<WH1> loved<WH157> him more than all his brothers,<WH251> and they hated<WH8130> him,<WH3201> and couldn't speak<WH1696> peaceably to him.<WH7965>
Joseph<WH3130> dreamed<WH2492> a dream,<WH2472> and he told<WH5046> it to his brothers,<WH251> and they hated<WH8130> him all the more.<WH3254>
He said<WH559> to them,<WH8085> "Please hear this dream<WH2472> which I have dreamed:<WH2492>

for behold,<WH481> we were binding sheaves<WH485> in the field,<WH7704> and behold,<WH485> my sheaf arose<WH6965> and also stood upright;<WH5324> and behold,<WH485> your sheaves came around,<WH5437> and bowed<WH7812> down to my sheaf.<WH485>"

His brothers<WH251> said<WH559> to him,<WH4427> "Will you indeed reign<WH4427> over us?<WH4910> Or will you indeed have dominion<WH4910> over us?<WH8130>" They hated him all the more<WH3254> for his dreams<WH2472> and for his words.<WH1697>

He dreamed<WH2492> yet another<WH312> dream,<WH2472> and told<WH5608> it to his brothers,<WH251> and said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH2492> I have dreamed yet another dream:<WH2472> and behold,<WH8121> the sun and the moon<WH3394> and eleven<WH6240> stars<WH3556> bowed down to me.<WH7812>"

He told<WH5608> it to his father<WH1> and to his brothers.<WH251> His father<WH1> rebuked<WH1605> him,<WH559> and said to him,<WH2472> "What is this dream that you have dreamed?<WH2492> Will I and your mother<WH517> and your brothers<WH251> indeed<WH935> come<WH935> to bow ourselves down<WH7812> to you to the earth?<WH776>"
His brothers<WH251> envied<WH7065> him,<WH1> but his father kept this saying<WH1697> in mind.<WH8104>
His brothers<WH251> went<WH3212> to feed<WH7462> their father<WH1>'s flock<WH6629> in Shechem.<WH7927>

Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> "Aren't<WH251> your brothers feeding<WH7462> the flock in Shechem?<WH7927> Come,<WH3212> and I will send you<WH7971> to them.<WH559>" He said to him, "Here I am."

He said<WH559> to him,<WH3212> "Go now,<WH7200> see whether it is well<WH7965> with your brothers,<WH251> and well<WH7965> with the flock;<WH6629> and bring<WH7725> me word<WH1697> again.<WH7725>" So he sent<WH7971> him out of the valley<WH6010> of Hebron,<WH2275> and he came<WH935> to Shechem.<WH7927>
A certain man<WH376> found him,<WH4672> and behold,<WH8582> he was wandering in the field.<WH7704> The man<WH376> asked him,<WH7592> "What<WH559> are you looking for?<WH1245>"
He said,<WH559> "I am looking<WH1245> for my brothers.<WH251> Tell<WH5046> me,<WH375> please, where they are feeding the flock.<WH7462>"

The man<WH376> said,<WH559> "They have left<WH5265> here,<WH2088> for I heard<WH8085> them say,<WH559> <WH3212> 'Let us go to Dothan.<WH1886>'" Joseph<WH3130> went<WH3212> after<WH310> his brothers,<WH251> and found<WH4672> them in Dothan.<WH1886>
They saw<WH7200> him afar off,<WH7350> and before he came near<WH7126> to them,<WH5230> they conspired against him to kill him.<WH4191>
They said<WH559> one<WH376> to another,<WH251> "Behold,<WH1976> this dreamer<WH1167> comes.<WH935>

Come<WH3212> now therefore,<WH2026> and let's kill him,<WH7993> and cast him into one<WH259> of the pits,<WH953> and we will say,<WH559> <WH7451> 'An evil animal<WH2416> has devoured<WH398> him.<WH7200>' We will see what will become of his dreams.<WH2472>"
Reuben<WH7205> heard<WH8085> it,<WH5337> and delivered him out of their hand,<WH559> and said, "Let<WH559>'s not take his life.<WH5221>"

Reuben<WH7205> said<WH559> to them,<WH8210> "Shed no blood.<WH1818> Throw<WH7993> him into this pit<WH953> that is in the wilderness,<WH4057> but lay<WH7971> no hand<WH3027> on him<WH5337>" â€”that he might deliver him out of their hand,<WH3027> to restore<WH7725> him to<WH7725> his father.<WH1>
It happened,<WH3947> when Joseph came to<WH7993> his brothers,<WH953> that they stripped Joseph<WH953> of his<WH7386> coat,<WH4325> the coat of many colors that was on him;
and they took<WH3947> him,<WH7993> and threw him into the pit.<WH953> The pit<WH953> was empty.<WH7386> There was no water in it.<WH4325>

They sat down<WH3427> to eat<WH398> bread,<WH3899> and they lifted up<WH5375> their eyes<WH5869> and looked,<WH7200> and saw a caravan<WH736> of Ishmaelites<WH3459> was coming<WH935> from Gilead,<WH1568> with their camels<WH1581> bearing<WH5375> spices<WH5219> and balm<WH6875> and myrrh,<WH3910> going<WH1980> to carry it down<WH3381> to Egypt.<WH4714>
Judah<WH3063> said<WH559> to his brothers,<WH251> "What profit<WH1215> is it if we kill<WH2026> our brother<WH251> and conceal<WH3680> his blood?<WH1818>

Come,<WH3212> and let<WH4376>'s sell him to the Ishmaelites,<WH3459> and not let our hand<WH3027> be on him;<WH251> for he is our brother, our flesh.<WH1320>" His brothers<WH251> listened to him.<WH8085>

Midianites<WH4084> who were merchants<WH582> passed<WH5674> by,<WH4900> and they drew and lifted up<WH5927> Joseph<WH3130> out of the pit,<WH953> and sold<WH4376> Joseph<WH3130> to the Ishmaelites<WH3459> for twenty<WH6242> pieces of silver.<WH3701> They brought<WH935> Joseph<WH3130> into Egypt.<WH4714>
Reuben<WH7205> returned<WH7725> to the pit;<WH953> and saw that Joseph<WH3130> wasn't<WH953> in the pit; and he tore<WH7167> his clothes.<WH899>
He returned<WH7725> to his brothers,<WH251> and said,<WH559> "The child<WH3206> is no more;<WH575> and I, where will I go?<WH935>"
They took<WH3947> Joseph<WH3130>'s coat,<WH3801> and killed<WH7819> a male<WH8163> goat,<WH5795> and dipped<WH2881> the coat<WH3801> in the blood.<WH1818>

They took<WH7971> the coat<WH3801> of many colors,<WH6446> and they brought<WH935> it to their father,<WH1> and said,<WH559> "We have found<WH4672> this.<WH5234> Examine it,<WH1121> now, whether it is your son's coat or not.<WH3801>"

He recognized it,<WH5234> and said,<WH559> "It is my son<WH1121>'s coat.<WH3801> An evil<WH7451> animal<WH2416> has devoured<WH398> him.<WH3130> Joseph is without doubt<WH2963> torn in pieces.<WH2963>"
Jacob<WH3290> tore<WH7167> his clothes,<WH8071> and put<WH7760> sackcloth<WH8242> on his waist,<WH4975> and mourned<WH56> for his son<WH1121> many<WH7227> days.<WH3117>

All his sons<WH1121> and all his daughters<WH1323> rose up<WH6965> to comfort<WH5162> him,<WH3985> but he refused to be comforted.<WH5162> He said,<WH559> "For I will go down<WH3381> to Sheol<WH7585> to my son<WH1121> mourning.<WH57>" His father<WH1> wept for him.<WH1058>
The Midianites<WH4092> sold<WH4376> him into Egypt<WH4714> to Potiphar,<WH6318> an officer<WH5631> of Pharaoh<WH6547>'s, the captain<WH8269> of the guard.<WH2876>
